snippet: A proposal by the chairman, Julius Genachowski, would “streamline and modernize” the longtime ban on owning both a newspaper and a TV or radio station.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission appears to be close to adopting rules that would relax longstanding ban on ownership of both a newspaper and a television or radio station in large metropolitan media markets.
lead_paragraph: A proposal by the chairman, Julius Genachowski, would “streamline and modernize” the longtime ban on owning both a newspaper and a TV or radio station.

headline.seo: F.C.C. Is Again Examining Looser Cross-Ownership Rules
